intro: Psychotria birotula, commonly known as the red psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria birotula is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
